org.diet4j.tomcat

Class TomcatModuleLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase
      • org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleMBeanBase
        • org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappLoader
          • org.diet4j.tomcat.TomcatModuleLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, EventListener, MBeanRegistration, org.apache.catalina.JmxEnabled, org.apache.catalina.Lifecycle, org.apache.catalina.Loader

    public class TomcatModuleLoader
extends org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappLoader
    This Tomcat-specific class can be specified as a WebappLoader in a Tomcat context.xml file in order to make the entire Tomcat app use diet4j. Note that the diet4j JARs must be accessible to Tomcat. Apparently bundling them with a web app's WAR file is not sufficient, and they must be Tomcat's library path. Use as follows in context.xml: 
     <Context path='/context-path'>
  <Loader className='org.diet4j.tomcat.TomcatModuleLoader'
          rootmodule='com.example.mywebapp'
          moduledirectory='/usr/share/java' />
 </Context>
    where com.example.mywebapp is the the name of the root module for this app, and moduledirectory is the directory where JARs of Modules can be found.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String theModuledirectory
      Directory in which the module JARs can be found.
      protected ModuleRegistry theModuleRegistry
      Keep a reference to the ModuleRegistries that we are using so they won't be garbage collected.

      Name of the root module.
